assertions.title: The screen reader MUST convey the list item role
assertions.rationale: A screen reader user needs to know when they enter a list item.
examples: When in an ordered list context, the list role might be conveyed with the position of the list item (1, 2, 3, etc.).
When in an unordered list context, the list role might be conveyed by the word "bullet" or position in the list.

assertions.title: The screen reader MUST convey the position of the current list item in the set
assertions.rationale: A screen reader user needs to know their position in a list.
examples: When in an ordered list context, the role might be conveyed with the position of the list item (1, 2, 3, etc.).
When in an unordered list context, the role might be conveyed by the word "bullet" or information about the position of the item in the list.
The position of the first item in the list might be implied by the first announcement of list semantics.
